definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
the hammer and sickle (flag of USSR, symbolizing rural and proletarian labor)

sentences.english: The hammer and sickle was flying over the roof.
sentences.chinese: 镰刀斧头旗在屋顶上下空飘扬。

sentences.english: So the Woodman seized his axe, and with one stroke cut the Serpent in cno.
sentences.chinese: 所以樵夫抓起他的一把斧头，将蛇一劈切成两段。

sentences.english: I have a good axe which is used to cut trees.
sentences.chinese: 我有一把可用来砍树的好斧头。

sentences.english: The woodcutter's axe whereaskged for its heachdle from the tree.
sentences.chinese: 樵夫财神客栈斧头，问树要斧柄。

sentences.english: They shouted louder and louder and finally hit each other on the head with their stone hatchets.
sentences.chinese: 他们喊出的呼声强烈，最后击中头部与石斧头对方。

sentences.english: They've pulled out the hatchets out anyway.
sentences.chinese: 他们已经拿出了斧头还行吧。

sentences.english: They use an axe and disfigure the rhino's face.
sentences.chinese: 他们用斧头砍，把犀牛的脸都砍坏了。

sentences.english: This axe was once used to hack an ex-girlfriends’ furniture.
sentences.chinese: 这把斧头曾经劈开前女友的家具。

sentences.english: But I expect a full strenght team to play against the Hammers.
sentences.chinese: 但是我期待我们队能够使出全力去击败斧头帮。

sentences.english: The artists then use axes3 and shovels4 to finish their creations.
sentences.chinese: 雪雕家们接着用斧头和铲子来完成创作。

sentences.english: Ma Huaide, a professor at China University of Political Science and Law, likened the laojiao system to an ax.
sentences.chinese: 中国政法大学的马怀德教授把劳教制度比喻为斧头。

sentences.english: Pick up the ax. Walk to the door.
Stockard turned, and cut off the Indian's head with his ax.
sentences.chinese: 斯多卡德回过身，用斧头砍下那个印地安人的头。

sentences.english: At the same time he dropped the hatchet and shifted the club to his right hand.
sentences.chinese: 他边说边丢掉斧头，把棍子换到右手。

sentences.english: Putting away his axe, he sawed down the tree instead.
sentences.chinese: 他放下斧头，而是锯倒了那棵树。

definition: to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
